resources.string: The student health and well-being app
Please fill in the form below and tell us what the appointment is about so we can prepare accordingly. A member from the team will contact you immediately with more information.

Previous research has revealed that some students will not notice when they are tending towards a mental illness until its too late. The goal therefore of this app is to help students be able to notice the signs and symptoms of these mental illnesses and therefore prevent them. This app does NOT aim at replacing the services you receive from your doctor. Please seek help from your doctor as usual and use the Focus app as a compliment.
This app aims at helping students prevent mental illnesses (depression,anxiety,stress).

The words we speak carry enormous power to either make or break, build or destroy. The Bible in Proverbs 18:21 says that death and life are in the power of the tongue, notice how the power is accredited to the tongue. It is therefore important that we speak the right things. The purpose of this section is to guide you on the kinds of things to say over yourself and your loved ones. All the confessions are taken from Bible verses and the verses are provided for personal reference and further study.

Riccarton General Practice "

The links below provide rich information on prevention of mental illnesses. Visit the sites to read more about these mental illnesses and get in a better position to prevent them.

Recommendations for people to contact based on your message history
A task needs to be reviewed!
This score reveals that you are not suffering from depression in a way that is harmful to your health, keep it this way but don\'t hesitate to see your doctor if you feel you need assistance

Some of the symptoms of this kind of depression include irritability/anger, hopelessness, feelings of guilt or despair and lack of motivation among others. If you have noticed any of these over the past days/weeks, we advise that you seek advise from your doctor on how to go about it.

Moderate depression shares similar symptoms with mild depression including problems with self esteem, reduced productivity, feelings of worthlessness, increased sensivities and excessive worrying. If you have been feeling this way over the past weeks and it has been hindering your normal work/activities, please seek help from you doctor.

Severe depression is classified as having the symptoms of mild to moderate depression, but the symptoms are severe and noticeable, even to your loved ones. This may also cause delusions, feelings of stupor, hallucinations and suicidal thoughts. This requires medical treatment and we advise that you see your doctor as soon as possible.

This score reveals that you are fine and not suffering from any kind of anxiety. Please monitor your progress after your next test to ensure all is well but if you feel something is still not right, do not hesitate to seek help.

With mild anxiety, the symptoms may not drastically hinder your life and stop you from functioning normally but you will still have constant worries, feelings of nervousness, nauseated or shaky. It is still advisable to seek help inorder to get more assistance.

This score indicates that you are having issues with anxiety in a way that it is starting to affect your normal life. The best solution for this is to seek professional help before the situation worsens.

Severe anxiety may cause panic attacks and make one feel as though they are having a heart a ttack and going to die. It totally hinders your life and you cannot function normally. Please seek help immediately.

This score indicates that you are living the worst possible quality of life according to the scale. You are probably anxious, depressed and stressed and NOW would be the best time to seek help. Please consider the recommendations provided.

This score indicates that you are living a poor quality of life. Reflect on the activities you have been doing and even better speak to a professional for more help on how to improve the quality of your life.
This score indicates that you are living a low quality of life. It does not necessarily indicate any kind of mental health issue but you are just not generally okay with things.

This score indicates that your quality of life is just okay. This score is around the average point and shows that you may not be very happy but are not very sad too. The good news is that it can be improved.
This score indicates that you are living a good quality of life. You are happy and satisfied with the way things have been going on for you. Keep it up.

This score indicates that you are living the best possible quality of life. You are in good spirits, full of vigour and are calm. In order to keep this score why don\'t you go ahead and read speak out some positive confessions about you.
This score indicates that you are not suffering from any kind of stress. This is good and even to keep it this way, please consider the recommendations provided.

Stress is how your body responds to certain situations and at times can help you do work to meet a deadline or stay clear-minded in chaotic situations but this is meant to be temporary. If the stress symptoms are persistent, it is advisable that you seek help.
This score indicates that you are experiencing stress which is also predictive of psychological distress. Seek a professional for further help to prevent the situation from worsening.
Please indicate for the statement below which is closest to how you have been feeling over the last two weeks.

string-array.name: who_5
string-array.item: I have felt cheerful and in good spirits
I have felt calm and relaxed
I have felt active and vigorous
I woke up feeling fresh and rested
My daily life has been filled with things that interest me

resources.string: Over the last two weeks, how much of the time;

string-array.name: mdi
string-array.item: Have you felt low in spirits or sad?
Have you lost interest in your daily activities?
Have you felt lacking in energy and strength?
Have you had a bad conscience or feelings of guilt?
Have you felt that life wasnâ€™t worth living?
Have you had difficulty in concentrating, e.g. when reading the newspaper or watching television?
Have you felt subdued or slowed down?
Have you had trouble sleeping at night?
Have you suffered from reduced appetite?
Have you suffered from increased appetite?

string-array.name: who_mdi_responses
string-array.item: Slightly less than half the time
Slightly more than half the time

resources.string: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problem?

string-array.name: gad7
string-array.item: Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge
Not being able to stop or control worrying
Worrying too much about different things
Being so restless that it is hard to sit still
Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen

resources.string: How often has the following caused you stress over the past month?
